newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Atlas forges agreement on Carmen mines.
newsitem.headline: Atlas forges agreement on Carmen mines.

text.p: Atlas Consolidated Mining and Development Corp said on Saturday it has signed an agreement with a group of investors for the rehabilitation of its copper mines on the central Philippine island of Cebu.

"Atlas signed an agreement with a group of investors represented by (businessman) Frank Lubbock on the rehabilitation, development and operation of its copper mines in Toledo, Cebu," the company said in a statement.
The firm did not identify its new partners.
"The investors represented by Mr Lubbock have investments in mining in the Philippines with another affiliated company," it said.
Atlas closed its Carmen underground mines on January 26, 1994 after a massive mudflow.
The Atlas copper mines had an output of 16,000 tonnes of ore per day before the closure.
